metadata.title: CVE-2022-31129 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description: moment is a JavaScript date library for parsing, validating, manipulating,and formatting dates. Affected versions of moment were found to use aninefficient parsing algorithm. Specifically using string-to-date parsing inmoment (more specifically rfc2822 parsing, which is tried by default) hasquadratic (N^2) complexity on specific inputs. Users may notice anoticeable slowdown is observed with inputs above 10k characters. Users whopass user-provided strings without sanity length checks to momentconstructor are vulnerable to (Re)DoS attacks. The problem is patched in2.29.4, the patch can be applied to all affected versions with minimaltweaking. Users are advised to upgrade. Users unable to upgrade shouldconsider limiting date lengths accepted from user input.

criterions.comment: node-moment package in xenial is affected and may need fixing.
wordpress package in xenial is affected and may need fixing.
sabnzbdplus package in xenial is affected and may need fixing.
gnucash package in xenial is affected and may need fixing.
ntopng package in xenial is affected and may need fixing.
